title: Hess Midstream to acquire Hess Infrastructure Partners in deal valued at about $6.2 billion
text: Hess Midstream Partners LP HESM, +0.77% shares rose 2.9% in premarket trade Friday, after the company said it has agreed to acquire Hess Infrastructure Partners LP in a deal valued at about $6.2 billion. Hess Midstream is a fee-based midstream company with assets primarily located in the Bakken and Three Forks Shale plays in the Williston Basin area of North Dakota. The company will assume about $1.15 billion of HIP debt and will issue about 230 million units and pay about $550 million in cash. The company said it will change its organizational structure to an "Up-C" structure, or Umbrella Partnership structure, that eliminates IDR (incentive distribution right) payments to sponsors. The company expects the deal to create a large-scale midstream company with an enterprise value of more than $7.25 billion. The deal is expected to immediately boost distributable cash flow per unit, or DCFPU with 6% accretion expected in 2020. The deal is expected to close in the fourth quarter. Hess Midstream said it now expects 2020 net income of $440 million to $480 million. Shares have gained 15% in 2019, while the S&P 500 SPX, +0.80% has gained 16%.
